fullDescription.intro:
Creates a new Spark Context. The settings e.g. dispose on reset affect all connected Spark nodes and their successors.
The default values of the node are taken from the Spark preference page which you can open via File->Preferences->KNIME->Spark.

tab.name: KNIME Settings
tab.option: The timeout of a Spark job.
The frequency KNIME has to check the job status.

If selected KNIME deletes the created named RDDs when the workflow or KNIME is closed. This way resources on the Spark job server are released but ALL nodes have to be re-executed the next time the workflow is opened.

tab.name: Spark Context Settings
tab.option: The unique name of the context.
The memory to allocate on each cluster node.
The number of cores per cluster node.

tab.name: Job Server Settings
tab.option: The protocol for the Spark job server connection.
The URL or IP address of the Spark job server.
The port the of the Spark job server.
The user name which is required if authentication is enabled in the Spark job server.
The password which is required if authentication is enabled in the Spark job server.
